      static void replaceMarkWith0and1(java.lang.String str)
      Given a string (for example: "a?bc?def?g"), write a program to generate all the possible strings by replacing ? with 0 and 1

      • printCombinationsOfZeroAndOne

        public static void printCombinationsOfZeroAndOne(int digits)
        Print combinations of zero and ones, given that number of digits are known.
        For example, given 2, combinations are 00, 01, 10, and 11
        Parameters:
        digits - - number of digits

      • fill

        private static void fill(int[] a,
        int digit,
        int start,
        int end)
        Helper method to print the combination in printCombinationsOfZeroAndOne(int)
        Parameters:
        a - - array to be filled into
        digit - - digit to be filled in start position;
        start - - begin position to be filled in
        end - - end position in the array. In ideal conditions, the start <= end

      • replaceMarkWith0and1

        public static void replaceMarkWith0and1(java.lang.String str)
        Given a string (for example: "a?bc?def?g"), write a program to generate all the possible strings by replacing ? with 0 and 1
        Logic is to replace the array's element with '?' and then recurse
        Parameters:
        str - input string

      • printWithMark

        private static void printWithMark(char[] str,
                 int current)
        Private function that actually performs the task of replacement and then recursion in replaceMarkWith0and1(String)
        Parameters:
        str - input string
        current - current index

      • instanceCompare

        public static java.lang.String instanceCompare(java.lang.String str1,
                               java.lang.String str2)
        From the input, return the string that has most number of common characters
        "aaabbddddd", "ddcccccccb" will return "aaabbddddd"
        "", "" will return ""
        Parameters:
        str1 - First input string
        str2 - Second input string
        Returns:
        Resulting string
